The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.

Comments_List: I learned the present and perfect past tenses, the nominative, accusative, and dative cases, and German vocabulary. These combine to a foundational knowledge of German.
I gained valuable experience in learning the basics of German.
I could learn various aspects of german, not only the language itself but also the culture
I think the class was set up wonderfully. I'm not familiar with pedagogical methods for teaching languages, so I do not think I could add anything substantive.

I think that this course does a good job giving a lot of information in a very short period of time. However the negative of this is that sometimes the class feels rushed and when I was having a hard time getting a concept, there was not a lot of time to get clarification.
While I appreciate the policy of only teaching the course in German, I think it would be helpful to teach the grammar sections in English.

If you want to learn German, I think that Yale is one of the best places to do it. There were a ton of extracurricular opportunities, and the class is definitely geared towards gaining an ability to speak the language as quickly as possible so it is great for people looking to go to Germany.
Yes, great professor and also very clear lesson plan.
Yes because I think German is a very important language to have an understanding of, especially for musicians like myself.
Yes! It's the best course to learn the language from the scratch
